data.message: Yes but how do you stop receiving alerts that they posted something - unfollowed but get a minimum 20+ alerts for this person......

replies.message: Thanks for your question, Amelia. You can turn off notifications for a friend by following these steps: http://on.fb.me/1RxLbgU. Hope this helps! -Kristin
Can I turn off ALL text notifications?
If they TAG you there's no way to stop that notifcation, which is my issue
Hi there, Janet. You can learn more about how you can adjust text notifications here: http://on.fb.me/1WfV2Pe. Hope this helps! -Rey

Hi Facebook
I requested for changing the name of fb page. At first they respond me your new name means your page category is different from the previous one and I told them not, they mean same.

Then they told me we dont support changing names in your language (Persian)!!!

I sent screenshot of my friend's page and link, he changed it 3 days ago and the name was in Persian. 

But they closed my topic and did not answer me anymore.

I'm really disappointed by this support.

Thanks for your time
How does someone change their name on Facebook, since it was spelled incorrectly.
How do I stop others from seeing which articles that I have "Liked".

I would like to see my friend's posts. But, I have to "unfollow" them so that I don't get the barrage of everything they "like." As a result, I no longer get to see my friend's posts or they see mine.

I would like to be able to see my friend's posts; but, not their "likes." 

This latest FB change has forced me to use other media types.

I haven't had any support from FB.
They are trying to sell advertizing and trying to find ways of keeping more of the pages we see .
How do I turn off notifications I get that a friend LIKED something on a non-friend's page/post?  DO I really need to keep Blocking My Friends's friends???
Yes! If someone wanted you to see something they would share it, not just like it!

Obviously, this isn't going to change; and, remains very frustrating. Because, the whole purpose of Facebook is to connect with the people and information you want. I don't want to know what my friends "like." Our interests are very different. It barrages my account with things I don't want to see.

So, more and more I've moved my social media activities to other types of social media forums. ...and, so are my friends, business associates and university colleagues.
